newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Lithuanian shares rise, further gains seen.
newsitem.headline: Lithuanian shares rise, further gains seen.

text.p: Lithuanian shares rose on Tuesday after a two-week slide and dealers said they expected to see further gains.
The young bourse's main index rose to 1,443.02, a gain of 26.13 points, amid central market turnover of 341,500 litas.
"Banks used to dominate, but investors are showing more interest in industrial companies and other enterprises," said one dealer.
"Some of these companies are beginning to show good profit figures and that is stimulating interest," he said, adding that further gains were expected, at least in the short-term.
The Birzhiu dairy was the leading blue chip, rising to five litas from 4.81 litas in trade of over 70,000 litas.
Nomura is currently managing a $6 million international equity listing for the dairy.
There was also almost 3.8 million litas worth of bloc trades on Tuesday.
Klaipedos Nafta, an oil terminal partly owned by U.S.-based Lancaster Steel Co, saw over 3.1 million litas worth of its shares traded.
Dealers were tight-lipped about the deal but the Lithuanian daily, Lietuvos rytas, said on Monday that Lancaster Steel was preparing to reduce its stake in the terminal.
The terminal has plans for a new 20 million litas share capital issue in which Russian oil concerns LUKoil and Yukos are expected to buy stakes.
That issue will not be a public offering distributed on the bourse.
